While its most famous event is the <i>encierro</i>, or the <a href="/wiki/Running_of_the_bulls" title="Running of the bulls">running of the bulls</a>, which happens at 8:00&nbsp;am from 7 July to 14 July, the seven days-long celebration involves many other traditional and folkloric events. The events were central to the plot of The Sun Also Rises, by <a href="/wiki/Ernest_Hemingway" title="Ernest Hemingway">Ernest Hemingway</a>, which brought it to the general attention of English-speaking people. As the result, it has become one of the most internationally renowned fiestas in Spain, with over 1,000,000 people attending every year. </p>
      <p>Other festivals include: <a href="/wiki/La_Tomatina" title="La Tomatina">La Tomatina</a> tomato festival in <a href="/wiki/Bu%C3%B1ol" title="Buñol">Buñol</a>, <a href="/wiki/Valencian_Community" title="Valencian Community">Valencia</a>, the carnivals in the <a href="/wiki/Canary_Islands" title="Canary Islands">Canary Islands</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Falles" title="Falles">Falles</a> in <a href="/wiki/Valencia" title="Valencia">Valencia</a> or the <a href="/wiki/Holy_Week" title="Holy Week">Holy Week</a> in Andalusia and <a href="/wiki/Castile_and_Le%C3%B3n" title="Castile and León">Castile and León</a>. </p> 
      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span></h2> 
      <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r936637989">.mw-parser-output .portal{border:solid #aaa 1px;padding:0}.mw-parser-output .portal.tleft{margin:0.5em 1em 0.5em 0}.mw-parser-output .portal.tright{margin:0.5em 0 0.5em 1em}.mw-parser-output .portal>ul{display:table;box-sizing:border-box;padding:0.1em;max-width:175px;background:#f9f9f9;font-size:85%;line-height:110%;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold}.mw-parser-output .portal>ul>li{display:table-row}.mw-parser-output .portal>ul>li>span:first-child{display:table-cell;padding:0.2em;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center}.mw-parser-output .portal>ul>li>span:last-child{display:table-cell;padding:0.2em 0.2em 0.2em 0.3em;vertical-align:middle}</style>

       <li><a href="/wiki/Outline_of_Spain" title="Outline of Spain">Outline of Spain</a></li>

      <div style="clear:both;"></div> 
      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span></h2> 
      <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1011085734">.mw-parser-output .reflist{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em;list-style-type:decimal}.mw-parser-output .reflist .references{font-size:100%;margin-bottom:0;list-style-type:inherit}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-2{column-width:30em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-3{column-width:25em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns ol{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-alpha{list-style-type:upper-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-roman{list-style-type:upper-roman}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-alpha{list-style-type:lower-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-greek{list-style-type:lower-greek}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-roman{list-style-type:lower-roman}</style>
      <div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha"> 
       <div class="mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns">
        <ol class="references"> 
         <li id="cite_note-a-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-a_2-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-a_2-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">The Spanish Constitution does not establish any official name for Spain, even though the terms <i lang="es" title="Spanish-language text">España</i> (Spain), <i lang="es" title="Spanish-language text">Estado español</i> (Spanish State) and <i lang="es" title="Spanish-language text">Nación española</i> (Spanish Nation) are used throughout the document. Nonetheless, the Spanish Ministry of Foreign Affairs established in an ordinance published in 1984 that the denominations <i lang="es" title="Spanish-language text">España</i> (Spain) and <i lang="es" title="Spanish-language text">Reino de España</i> (Kingdom of Spain) are equally valid to designate Spain in international treaties. The latter term is widely used by the government in national and international affairs of all kinds, including foreign treaties as well as national official documents, and is therefore recognised as the official name by many international organisations.<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1">[1]</a></sup></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-b-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-b_3-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-b_3-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">In Spain, <a href="/wiki/Languages_of_Spain" title="Languages of Spain">other languages</a> are officially recognised as legitimate <a href="/wiki/Indigenous_language" title="Indigenous language">autochthonous</a> <a href="/wiki/Regional_language" title="Regional language">(regional) languages</a> under the <a href="/wiki/Spanish_Constitution" class="mw-redirect" title="Spanish Constitution">Spanish Constitution</a>. In each of these, Spain's official name (Spanish: <i lang="es">Reino de España</i>, pronounced: <small></small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Spanish" title="Help:IPA/Spanish">[ˈrejno ð(e) esˈpaɲa]</a></span>) is as follows: 
           <ul>
            <li><a href="/wiki/Catalan_language" title="Catalan language">Catalan</a>: <i lang="ca">Regne d'Espanya</i>, <small>IPA:&nbsp;</small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Catalan" title="Help:IPA/Catalan">[ˈreŋnə ðəsˈpaɲə]</a></span></li> 
            <li><a href="/wiki/Basque_language" title="Basque language">Basque</a>: <i lang="eu">Espainiako Erresuma</i>, <small>IPA:&nbsp;</small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Basque" title="Help:IPA/Basque">[es̺paɲiako eres̺uma]</a></span></li> 
            <li><a href="/wiki/Galician_language" title="Galician language">Galician</a>: <i lang="gl">Reino de España</i>, <small>IPA:&nbsp;</small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Galician" title="Help:IPA/Galician">[ˈrejnʊ ð(ɪ) esˈpaɲɐ]</a></span></li> 
            <li><a href="/wiki/Occitan_language" title="Occitan language">Occitan</a>: <i lang="oc">Reiaume d'Espanha</i>, <small>IPA:&nbsp;</small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Occitan" title="Help:IPA/Occitan">[reˈjawme ðesˈpaɲɔ]</a></span></li>
           </ul> </span></li> 
         <li id="cite_note-c-6"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-c_6-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The official language of the State is established in the Section 3 of the <a href="/wiki/Spanish_Constitution_of_1978" class="mw-redirect" title="Spanish Constitution of 1978">Spanish Constitution of 1978</a> to be Castilian.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5">[3]</a></sup> In some <a href="/wiki/Autonomous_communities_of_Spain" title="Autonomous communities of Spain">autonomous communities</a>, <a href="/wiki/Catalan_language" title="Catalan language">Catalan</a>, <a href="/wiki/Galician_language" title="Galician language">Galician</a>, <a href="/wiki/Basque_language" title="Basque language">Basque</a> and <a href="/wiki/Occitan_language" title="Occitan language">Occitan</a> (locally known as <a href="/wiki/Aranese_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Aranese language">Aranese</a>) are co-official languages. <a href="/wiki/Aragonese_language" title="Aragonese language">Aragonese</a> and <a href="/wiki/Asturian_language" title="Asturian language">Asturian</a> have some degree of official recognition.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-9"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-9">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a> (EU) since 1993.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-14"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-14">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">As of 1 January 2020, the Spanish population increased in 392,921 in 2019, reaching a number of 47,330 million inhabitants. In the same period of time, the number of citizens with Spanish citizenship reached 42,094,606. The number of foreigners (i.e. immigrants, ex-pats and refugees, without including foreign born nationals with Spanish citizenship) permanently living in Spain was estimated to be at 5,235,375 (11.06%) in 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-cp_2020_13-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cp_2020-13">[9]</a></sup></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-18"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-18">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The <a href="/wiki/Spanish_peseta" title="Spanish peseta">Peseta</a> before 2002.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-e-19"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-e_19-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The <a href="/wiki/.eu" title=".eu">.eu</a> domain is also used, as it is shared with other <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a> member states. Also, the <a href="/wiki/.cat" title=".cat">.cat</a> domain is used in <a href="/wiki/Catalonia" title="Catalonia">Catalonia</a>, <a href="/wiki/.gal" title=".gal">.gal</a> in <a href="/wiki/Galiza" class="mw-redirect" title="Galiza">Galicia</a> and <a href="/wiki/.eus" title=".eus">.eus</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Basque_Country_(autonomous_community)" title="Basque Country (autonomous community)">Basque-Country</a> autonomous regions.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-22"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-22">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">See <a href="/wiki/List_of_transcontinental_countries" title="List of transcontinental countries">list of transcontinental countries</a>.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-42"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-42">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The <i><a href="/wiki/Latifundia" class="mw-redirect" title="Latifundia">latifundia</a></i> (sing., <i>latifundium</i>), large estates controlled by the aristocracy, were superimposed on the existing Iberian landholding system.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-44"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-44">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The poets <a href="/wiki/Martial" title="Martial">Martial</a>, <a href="/wiki/Quintilian" title="Quintilian">Quintilian</a> and <a href="/wiki/Lucan" title="Lucan">Lucan</a> were also born in Hispania.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-51"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-51">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The Berbers soon gave up attempting to settle the harsh lands in the north of the <a href="/wiki/Meseta_Central" title="Meseta Central">Meseta Central</a> (Inner Plateau) handed to them by the Arab rulers.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-78"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-78">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">For the related expulsions that followed see <a href="/wiki/Morisco" title="Morisco">Morisco</a>.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-Nationalities-231"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Nationalities_231-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The term "nationality" was chosen carefully in order to avoid the more politically charged term "nation", however in recent years it has been proposed to use this term in the Constitution and officially recognise Spain as a plurinational state ("nation of nations").</span> </li> 
        </ol>
       </div>
      </div>

         <li id="cite_note-eurogini-16"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-eurogini_16-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/tgm/table.do?tab=table&amp;init=1&amp;language=en&amp;pcode=tessi190&amp;plugin=1">"Gini coefficient of equivalised disposable income – EU-SILC survey"</a>. <i>ec.europa.eu</i>. <a href="/wiki/Eurostat" title="Eurostat">Eurostat</a><span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-29"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-29">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFHenleyBlokker" class="citation journal cs1">Henley, Peter H.; Blokker, Niels M. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.austlii.edu.au/au/journals/MelbJIL/2013/18.pdf">"The Group of 20: A Short Legal Anatomy"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>Melbourne Journal of International Law</i>. <b>14</b>: 568<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">23 October</span> 2018</span>. <q>Spain’s peculiar but seemingly secure position within the G20 also appears to have facilitated their greater participation in the G20s work: Spain is the only outreach participant to have made policy commitments comparable to those of G20 members proper at summits since Seoul. Spain therefore appears to have become a de facto member of the G20.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Melbourne+Journal+of+International+Law&amp;rft.atitle=The+Group+of+20%3A+A+Short+Legal+Anatomy&amp;rft.volume=14&amp;rft.pages=568&amp;rft.aulast=Henley&amp;rft.aufirst=Peter+H.&amp;rft.au=Blokker%2C+Niels+M.&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.austlii.edu.au%2Fau%2Fjournals%2FMelbJIL%2F2013%2F18.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ASpain" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-anthon-35"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-anthon_35-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-anthon_35-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFAnthon1850" class="citation book cs1">Anthon, Charles (1850). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/asystemancienta03anthgoog"><i>A system of ancient and mediæval geography for the use of schools and colleges</i></a>. New York: Harper &amp; Brothers. p.&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/asystemancienta03anthgoog/page/n28">14</a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=A+system+of+ancient+and+medi%C3%A6val+geography+for+the+use+of+schools+and+colleges&amp;rft.place=New+York&amp;rft.pages=14&amp;rft.pub=Harper+%26+Brothers&amp;rft.date=1850&amp;rft.aulast=Anthon&amp;rft.aufirst=Charles&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fasystemancienta03anthgoog&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ASpain" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-36"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-36">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Abrabanel, <i>Commentary on the First Prophets</i> (<i>Pirush Al Nevi'im Rishonim</i>), end of II Kings, pp. 680–681, Jerusalem 1955 (Hebrew). See also Shelomo (also spelled Sholomo, Solomon or Salomón) ibn Verga, <i>Shevet Yehudah</i>, pp. 6b–7a, Lemberg 1846 (Hebrew)</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-Science2012-37"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Science2012_37-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Science2012_37-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-38"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-38">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/science/nature/6256356.stm">"<span class="cs1-kern-left">'</span>First west Europe tooth' found"</a>. BBC. 30 June 2007. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20091021003923/http://encarta.msn.com/text_761575057___0/Spain.html">Archived</a> from the original on 21 October 2009<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">9 August</span> 2008</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=%27First+west+Europe+tooth%27+found&amp;rft.date=2007-06-30&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F2%2Fhi%2Fscience%2Fnature%2F6256356.stm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ASpain" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-39"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-39">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Typical <a href="/wiki/Aurignacian" title="Aurignacian">Aurignacian</a> items were found in Cantabria (Morín, El Pendo, <a href="/wiki/Cave_of_El_Castillo" title="Cave of El Castillo">El Castillo</a>), the Basque Country (Santimamiñe) and Catalonia. The radiocarbon datations give the following dates: 32,425 and 29,515 BP.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="white-space:nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability" title="Wikipedia:Verifiability"><span title="The material near this tag failed verification of its source citation(s). (January 2016)">failed verification</span></a></i>]</sup>[</span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-Haywood-54"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Haywood_54-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Haywood_54-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Haywood_54-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-Naimark-84"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Naimark_84-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFNaimark2017" class="citation book cs1">Naimark, Norman M. (2017). <i>Genocide: A World History</i>. <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Press" title="Oxford University Press">Oxford University Press</a>. p.&nbsp;35. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-976527-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-976527-0"><bdi>978-0-19-976527-0</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Genocide%3A+A+World+History&amp;rft.pages=35&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2017&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-976527-0&amp;rft.aulast=Naimark&amp;rft.aufirst=Norman+M.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ASpain" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTENaimark201735-85"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTENaimark201735_85-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFNaimark2017">Naimark 2017</a>, p.&nbsp;35.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-86"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-86">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFGuillermo2012" class="citation book cs1">Guillermo, Artemio (2012) [2012]. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=wmgX9M_yETIC&amp;q=divide+and+conquer+philippines&amp;pg=PA374"><i>Historical Dictionary of the Philippines</i></a>. The Scarecrow Press Inc. p.&nbsp;374. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9780810875111" title="Special:BookSources/9780810875111"><bdi>9780810875111</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">11 September</span> 2020</span>. <q>To pursue their mission of conquest, the Spaniards dealt individually with each settlement or village and with each province or island until the entire Philippine archipelago was brought under imperial control. They saw to it that the people remained divided or compartmentalized and with the minimum of contact or communication. The Spaniards adopted the policy of divide et impera (divide and conquer).</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Historical+Dictionary+of+the+Philippines&amp;rft.pages=374&amp;rft.pub=The+Scarecrow+Press+Inc.&amp;rft.date=2012&amp;rft.isbn=9780810875111&amp;rft.aulast=Guillermo&amp;rft.aufirst=Artemio&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DwmgX9M_yETIC%26q%3Ddivide%2Band%2Bconquer%2Bphilippines%26pg%3DPA374&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ASpain" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-87"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-87">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Reviving the Reconquista in Southeast Asia: Moros and the Making of the Philippines, 1565–1662 By: Ethan P. Hawkley</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-88"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-88">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20080629000351/http://www.ucalgary.ca/applied_history/tutor/eurvoya/Imperial.html">"Imperial Spain"</a>. University of Calgary. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.ucalgary.ca/applied_history/tutor/eurvoya/Imperial.html">the original</a> on 29 June 2008<span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-89"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-89">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation book cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Y84wAgaXxo4C&amp;lpg=PA472"><i>Handbook of European History</i></a>. Penguin Random House Grupo Editorial España. 1994. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/90-04-09760-0" title="Special:BookSources/90-04-09760-0"><bdi>90-04-09760-0</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Handbook+of+European+History&amp;rft.pub=Penguin+Random+House+Grupo+Editorial+Espa%C3%B1a&amp;rft.date=1994&amp;rft.isbn=90-04-09760-0&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DY84wAgaXxo4C%26lpg%3DPA472&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ASpain" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-140"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-140">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.ipsnews.net/2007/03/spain-no-turning-back-from-path-to-gender-equality/">"SPAIN: No Turning Back from Path to Gender Equality"</a>.          <li id="cite_note-155"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-155">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

Spanish Constitution of 1978</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-174"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-174">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-Demographia-227"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Demographia_227-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Demographia_227-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.demographia.com/db-worldua.pdf">"World Urban Areas: Population &amp; Density"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <a href="/wiki/Wendell_Cox" title="Wendell Cox">Demographia</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110805030244/http://www.demographia.com/db-worldua.pdf">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 5 August 2011<span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-CIS-274"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-CIS_274-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-CIS_274-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFCentro_de_Investigaciones_Sociológicas_(Centre_for_Sociological_Research)2019" class="citation web cs1"><i>Centro de Investigaciones Sociológicas</i> (Centre for Sociological Research) (October 2019). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.cis.es/cis/opencm/ES/1_encuestas/estudios/ver.jsp?estudio=14473&amp;cuestionario=17452&amp;muestra=24446">"Macrobarómetro de octubre 2019, Banco de datos"</a> (in Spanish). p.&nbsp;160<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 December</span> 2019</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Macrobar%C3%B3metro+de+octubre+2019%2C+Banco+de+datos&amp;rft.pages=160&amp;rft.date=2019-10&amp;rft.au=%27%27Centro+de+Investigaciones+Sociol%C3%B3gicas%27%27+%28Centre+for+Sociological+Research%29&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cis.es%2Fcis%2Fopencm%2FES%2F1_encuestas%2Festudios%2Fver.jsp%3Festudio%3D14473%26cuestionario%3D17452%26muestra%3D24446&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ASpain" class="Z3988"></span> The question was "¿Cómo se define Ud. en materia religiosa: católico/a practicante, católico/a no practicante, creyente de otra religion, agnóstico/a, indiferente o no creyente, o ateo/a?", the weight used was "PESOCCAA" which reflects the population sizes of the <a href="/wiki/Autonomous_communities_of_Spain" title="Autonomous communities of Spain">Autonomous communities of Spain</a>.</span> </li>

           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://historyofphilosophy.net/islamic-world/andalusia">"Andalusia | History of Philosophy without any gaps"</a>. <i>historyofphilosophy.net</i><span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-286"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-286">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

                   <li><a href="/wiki/Montenegro" title="Montenegro">Montenegro</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_the_Netherlands" title="Kingdom of the Netherlands">Netherlands</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/North_Macedonia" title="North Macedonia">North Macedonia</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Norway" title="Norway">Norway</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Poland" title="Poland">Poland</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Portugal" title="Portugal">Portugal</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">Romania</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Russia" title="Russia">Russia</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/San_Marino" title="San Marino">San Marino</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Serbia" title="Serbia">Serbia</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Slovakia" title="Slovakia">Slovakia</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Slovenia" title="Slovenia">Slovenia</a></li> 
                   <li><a class="mw-selflink selflink">Spain</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Sweden" title="Sweden">Sweden</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Switzerland" title="Switzerland">Switzerland</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Turkey" title="Turkey">Turkey</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Ukraine" title="Ukraine">Ukraine</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom" title="United Kingdom">United Kingdom</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Vatican_City" title="Vatican City">Vatican City</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
                <td class="noviewer navbox-image" rowspan="4" style="width:1px;padding:0px 0px 0px 2px;padding:0 0.5em;">
                 <div>
                  <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe"><img alt="Europe orthographic Caucasus Urals boundary (with borders).svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Europe_orthographic_Caucasus_Urals_boundary_%28with_borders%29.svg/100px-Europe_orthographic_Caucasus_Urals_boundary_%28with_borders%29.svg.png" decoding="async" width="100" height="100" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Europe_orthographic_Caucasus_Urals_boundary_%28with_borders%29.svg/150px-Europe_orthographic_Caucasus_Urals_boundary_%28with_borders%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/Europe_orthographic_Caucasus_Urals_boundary_%28with_borders%29.svg/200px-Europe_orthographic_Caucasus_Urals_boundary_%28with_borders%29.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="537" data-file-height="536"></a>
                 </div></td>
               </tr>

               <tr>
                <td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3" style="text-align:left;">
                 <div>
                  <div class="plainlist">
                   <ul>
                    <li><sup>1</sup> <a href="/wiki/Island#Oceanic_islands" title="Island">Oceanic islands</a> within the vicinity of Europe are usually grouped with the continent even though they are not situated on its continental shelf.</li>
                    <li><sup>2</sup> Some countries completely outside the conventional geographical boundaries of Europe are commonly associated with the continent due to ethnological links.</li>
                   </ul>
                  </div>
                 </div></td>

                       <li><a href="/wiki/Yang_di-Pertuan_Agong" title="Yang di-Pertuan Agong">Malaysia</a></li> 
                       <li><a href="/wiki/Monarchy_of_Thailand" title="Monarchy of Thailand">Thailand</a></li>
                      </ul> 
                     </div></td>
                   </tr>
                   <tr>
                    <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Monarchies_in_Europe" title="Monarchies in Europe">Europe</a></th>

                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Member_states_of_the_Council_of_Europe" title="Member states of the Council of Europe">Members</a></th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em">

          <th id="Authority_control_frameless_&amp;#124;text-top_&amp;#124;10px_&amp;#124;alt=Edit_this_at_Wikidata_&amp;#124;link=https&amp;#58;//www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q29#identifiers&amp;#124;Edit_this_at_Wikidata" scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Help:Authority_control" title="Help:Authority control">Authority control</a> <a href="https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q29#identifiers" title="Edit this at Wikidata"><img alt="Edit this at Wikidata" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/8a/OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg/10px-OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg.png" decoding="async" width="10" height="10" style="vertical-align: text-top" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/8a/OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg/15px-OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/8a/OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg/20px-OOjs_UI_icon_edit-ltr-progressive.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="20" data-file-height="20"></a></th>
